transcript mlt.Title: Raġel ta’ 51 sena jinqatel f’hit and run fiż-Żejtun

Transcript.text: Il-Pulizija qed tinvestiga s-sejba ta’ raġel mejjet fiż-Żejtun.
Ir-raġel għandu 51 sena u huwa miż-Żejtun.
Minn informazzjoni li għandu TVMnews jidher li qed issir tfittxija għal karozza.
Jidher li l-karozza, suspettata li tajritu, intlemħet fuq kameras tas-sigurtà.
Ir-raġel instab ġo għalqa fi Triq Anton Buttigieg għall-ħabta ta’ 12.15pm.
Il-katavru nstab ħdejn id-dwal tat-traffiku minn fejn jaqsmu n-nies.
Ir-raġel kien iċċertifikat mejjet fuq il-post.
Bħalissa t-triq tinsab magħluqa għat-traffiku.
Il-Pulizija għaddejja bl-investigazzjonijiet tagħha biex tistabilixxi x’ġara.
Fuq il-post hemm esperti forensiċi li qed jeżaminaw ix-xena tal-inċident.
Dwar dan il-każ infetħet inkjesta maġisterjali mmexxija mill-Maġistrat Marse-Ann Farrugia.
Doctors for Road Safety (D4RS) irreaġġixxiet għal din it-traġedja li ddeskriviet bħala “telfa oħra ta’ ħajja mingħajr sens fuq it-toroq tagħna”.

Waqt li tat il-kondoljanzi tagħha lil-familja tal-vittma hija qalet li temmen li wasal iż-żmien li jintużaw aħjar il-kameras tas-sigurtà pubbliċi biex jiġu evitati dawn it-traġedji iktar milli sabiex jiġu analizzati wara li jkunu ġraw.

transcript eng.Title: UPDATE (2): Man found dead in Żejtun field – search underway for car thought to have hit him

Transcript.text: The Police are investigating the discovery of a dead man in Żejtun.
The man is 51 years old and hails from Żejtun.
TVM News is informed a search is underway for a car.
It appears the car, which is suspected of having hit the man, was spotted on security cameras.
The body was found in a field in Triq Anton Buttigieg at about 12.15 p.m.
The body was found close to traffic lights and a pedestrian crossing.
The person was certified dead at the scene.
The road is presently closed to traffic.
The Police are investigating in order to establish the dynamics of the case.
Forensic experts are on site to examine the scene of the accident.

transcript mlt.Title: Sitt inċidenti tat-traffiku fatali bejn April u Ġunju

Transcript.text: L-inċidenti tat-traffiku li seħħew bejn April u Ġunju kienu fatali għal 6 persuni, skont ċifri ppubblikati mill-Uffiċċju Nazzjonali tal-Istatistika (NSO).
Sal-ewwel nofs ta’ din is-sena mietu 15-il persuna f’inċidenti tat-traffiku. Dan kien ifisser 13 iktar minn Jannar sa Ġunju tas-sena li għaddiet.
Il-vittmi fl-ewwel 6 xhur ta’ din is-sena kienu kollha rġiel bl-iktar lokalità li fiha seħħew inċidenti kienet Birkirkara.
Ċifri tal-NSO juru li l-inċidenti tat-traffiku bejn April u Ġunju kienu jgħoddu mal-4,240, 18% aktar meta mqabbel mal-istess perjodu tas-sena li għaddiet.

Jirriżulta li 6 kienu fatali, bil-vittmi kienu lkoll irgiel, bi 2 minn dawk li mietu kienu xufiera involuti f’ħabta ma’ vetturi oħra, xufier ieħor li miet wara li baqa’ dieħel fi propjetà u 3 persuni mietu wara li ttajru minn vetturi.
Dawk li ndarbu fl-inċidenti li seħħew bejn April u Ġunju li għaddew żdiedu bi kważi 9% meta mqabbel fuq l-istess perjodu tas-sena li għaddiet, li jfisser li korrew aktar minn 455 persuna.

Kien hemm 98 persuna – 67 sewwieq, 13-il passiġġier u 18-il persuna li kienu miexja fit-triq – li ndarbu gravi waqt li bejn April u Ġunju kienu 11 iċ-ċiklisti involuti f’inċidenti tat-traffiku li lkoll sofrew ġrieħi ħfief.

L-ikbar ammont ta’ inċidenti seħħew f’B’Kara b’294 inċident segwita minn San Pawl il-Baħar u Ħal Qormi. Il-lokalitajiet fejn ġraw l-inqas inċidenti tat-traffiku kienu Santa Luċija f’Malta u San Lawrenz f’Għawdex.
Meta tingħadd l-istatistika għall-ewwel 6 xhur tas-sena seħħew 7,835 inċident, li jfisser 17.5% iktar minn Jannar sa Ġunju tas-sena li għaddiet.
B’kollox fl-ewwel nofs tas-sena mietu 15-il persuna f’inċidenti tat-traffiku, li jfisser 13-il fatalità iktar meta mqabbel mal-istess perjodu s-sena l-oħra.

transcript eng.Title: Six fatal traffic incidents between April and June

Transcript.text: There have been six fatal traffic incidents between April and June according to figures published by the National Office for Statistics, NSO.
By mid-year 15 persons have died in road incidents and this means 13 more than for the same period last year.
The victims during the first six months were all males and the scene of most incidents was Birkirkara.
NSO figures show the number of traffic incidents between April and June were 4,240, that is, 18% more compared to the same period last year.
Six of the victims, all males, proved fatal, two involved in a collision with another vehicle. Another who crashed into a property and three were runover by a vehicle.
Those injured increased by 9% over the same three-month period last year with a total of 455 injuries.
There were 98 persons injured who were proceeding along the road – 67 drivers, 13 passengers and 18 pedestrians while eleven cyclists suffered light injuries.
The greater number of incidents took place at Birkirkara with 294 incidents, followed by St Paul’s Bay and Qormi. The least incidents were recorded in Santa Luċija in Malta and San Lawrenz in Gozo.
A total compilation of statistics for the first six months shows that 7,835 incidents occurred which is 17% more than for the ame period last year.

transcript mlt.Title: AĠĠORNAT (2): Erbgħa l-isptar wara l-ħabta bejn 3 karozzi f’Ħal Far

Transcript.text: Erba’ persuni ddaħħlu l-Isptar Mater Dei kawża tal-ħabta li seħħet dalgħodu bejn 3 karozzi f’Ħal Far.
Fl-inċident kienu involuti Toyota, VW u Mercedes.
Fuq il-post hemm numru ta’ pulizija kif ukoll uffiċjali mid-Dipartiment tal-Protezzjoni Ċivili.
Il-pumpieri tat-tifi tan-nar tfew in-nar li beda ħiereġ mit-Toyota.
Kelliem għall-Pulizija kkonfermalna li l-inċident seħħ għall-ħabta tal-11am.
Il-Pulizija għadha għaddejja bl-investigazzjonijiet tagħha.

transcript eng.Title: UPDATED (2): Four hospitalised after three vehicle collision at Ħal Far

Transcript.text: Four persons have been hospitalised at Mater Dei after a three vehicle collision at Ħal Far this morning.
The three vehicles involved were a Toyota, a VW and a Mercedes.

A number of officials from the Police and Civil Protection were present and a fire in the Toyota was extinguished by fire fighters. A Police Spokesperson confirmed the incident happened at about 11am and Police investigations are ongoing

transcript mlt.Title: Il-koppja li tonfoq €2,500 fix-xahar biex tikkura lil bintha ta’ 3 snin

Transcript.text: Ġenituri ta’ tifla ta’ 3 snin, li għandha marda rari, qalu lil TVMnews li l-imħabba, ir-rispett u l-għajnuna li jsibu minn dawk ta’ madwarhom jgħinuhom iqattgħu iktar ħin ma’ binthom li teħtieġ sostenn kontinwu minħabba l-kundizzjoni li għandha.

Charmaine u Daniel Ferriggi rrakkontaw kif binthom Kate teħtieġ 6 tipi differenti ta’ terapija ta’ 3 sigħat u nofs kull darba iżda sostnew li l-ġenerożità u s-solidarjetà li qed isibu minn qraba u ħbieb tagħhom qed jirrendu fi progress li qed tagħmel binthom kull meta tieħu l-kura meħtieġa.
Kate Ferriggi hija tifla ta’ 3 snin li tbati minn marda rari msejjħa Tatton-Brown Rahman Syndrome, magħrufa bħala TBRS.
Din il-marda twassal biex persuna tikber b’rata iktar mgħaġġla min-normal kemm qabel kif ukoll wara t-twelid. B’hekk din il-kundizzjoni tirriżulta tul aktar min-normal fil-persuna.
It-TBRS hija klassifikata bħala marda rari. Min ibati biha jista’ jkollu traċċi ta’ awtiżmu li jistgħu jaffettwaw il-ħiliet tal-peruna biex tikkomunika u tissoċjalizza.
Omm it-tifla Charmaine Ferriggi tkellmet ma’ TVMnews dwar din il-kundizzjoni ta’ bintha.
Hawn madwar 150,200 persuna li jafu bihom, il-mutazzjoni ta’ Kate m’hawn ħadd bħalu fid-dinja.
Transcript.author: Charmaine Ferriggi

Transcript.text: Charmaine spjegat li Kate ma timxix u mhix kapaċi tikkomunika anke jekk bejniethom sabu mod kif permezz ta’ buzzers fid-dar tinduna b’dak li tkun teħtieġ bintha.
Hija żiedet tgħid li minkejja dan it-tifla xorta kapaċi titgħallem u tattendi skola kuljum.

Taf in-numri, il-forom, tagħraf il-kuluri f’livell ta’ 5 snin għalkemm għandha 3 snin, per eżempju waħda mill-biżgħat tagħna hi li tkun frustrata peress li qisu xi ħadd maqbud ġo ġisem u ma tistax. Meta tiġi d-dar nindunaw li kellha ġurnata tajba għax tibda tifraħ u tidħkilna, imma apparti hekk Kate x’ħin tispiċċa skola flok bħal tfal oħra tiġi d-dar u toqgħod tilgħab ikollha tmur tkompli bit-terapiji.
Transcript.author: Charmaine Ferriggi

Transcript.text: It-terapiji ta’ Kate jikkonsistu f’aktar minn 6 tipi differenti u tqatta’ 3 sigħat u nofs kull darba għand il-professjonisti biex tieħu l-kura meħtieġa għal din il-marda rari.
Il-ġenituri ta’ Kate spjegaw li l-ispejjeż ta’ kull xahar ma jonqsux u l-ammont jitla’ għal €2,500 kull xahar.
Missierha Daniel spjega kif jekk imqar taqbeż sezzjoni terapewtika, saħħet Kate tmur lura. Iżda l-hena tiegħu jara lil bintu tagħmel progress ma’ kull jum li jgħaddi.

Meta nara lit-tifla tagħmel progress, anke żgħir, sa dment it-tifla mhux qed tmur lura trid tibqa’ taħdem, ovvjament tieħu l-ħajja kif tiġi, aħna għandna d-dinja biha, jekk naraw li qed tagħmel progress żgħir nibqgħu naħdmu, ovvjament jiġu xhur fejn ngħidu rridu naqtgħu xi ħaġa minnhom però l-Bambin dejjem jipprovdi u dejjem nagħmlu l-aħjar biex nagħtuha li għandha bżonn.
Transcript.author: Daniel Ferriggi

Transcript.text: Bis-sempliċità tagħha Kate turina li tħobbna, nistaqsiha “tħobbha lill-mama u tmellisli wiċċi, tidħakli u naf li bid-diffikultajiet kollha tagħha qed tifhem u qegħda kuntenta, għax dik l-aktar ħaġa importanti, li apparti t-tbatija kollha li tbati tgawdi l-ħajja ta’ tifla li hi.
Transcript.author: Charmaine Ferriggi

Transcript.text: Il-kollegi tax-xogħol ta’ Charmaine li jaħdmu f’7 skejjel għenuha tqatta’ kemm jista’ jkun ħin ma’ bintha Kate billi ġabru il-ġranet leave taghhom flimkien u tawhulha biex issarrfu fuq perjodu ta’ 3 snin.

Azzjonijiet bhal dawn fost l-imħabba u għajnuna li jsibu kuljum mingħand familjari u ħbieb huma li jżommu lill-ġenituri ta’ Kate bi tbissima u ma jaqtgħu qalbhom qatt biex jaraw lil binthom tgħix ħajja normali bħal tfal oħra.

transcript eng.Title: Couple spends €2,500 a month for 3-year old child’s treatment

Transcript.text: Chairmaine and Daniel Ferriggi recounted with TVMnews that their 3-year old daughter needs six different 3-hour therapy each time, however they say that the generosity and solidarity from relatives and friends is having the progress that assists their child each time treatment is needed.
Kate Ferriggi suffers from a rare disease called Tatton-Brown Rahman Syndrome, known as TBRS, that leads a person to grow with an accelerated rate than normal, both before and after birth.
TBRS is classified as a rare disease, with sufferers may experience traces of autism that may affect a person’s skills to communicate and socialise.
Kate’s mother Chaimaine Ferriggi spoke to TVMnews about her daughter’s condition.
There are some 150,200 persons with the condition…Kate’s mutation is nowhere to be found in the world.
Transcript.author: Charmaine Ferriggi

Transcript.text: Kate cannot walk and is not capable of communicating, even though the mother says that, through home buzzers, she can realise what her daughter needs. Charmaine adds that despite this her daughter is capable of learning and attending school daily.

She can identify numbers, forms and colours at a level of five-year old although she is only aged 3….one of our worries is that she is frustrated as if someone is caught inside her body and she cannot…When she returns home we notice that she had a good day because she smiles and laughs, and contrary to other children after school she continues with therapy.
Transcript.author: Charmaine Ferriggi

Transcript.text: Kate’s parents said they spend €2,500 monthly in costs, with father Daniel adds that when she skips a therapy session, Kate’s health deteriorates.
She is our world especially when we see her making progress in her health….obviously there are months when we have to cut expenses, however God always delivers and we do everything for her needs.
Transcript.author: Daniel Ferriggi

Transcript.text: Charmaine’s colleagues, who work in seven schools, have assisted her so that she spends time with Kate and gave her their leave days to use on a three-year period.

transcript mlt.Title: Il-PN jitlob laqgħa bejn 2 kumitati parlamentari dwar il-bilanċ bejn ix-xogħol u l-ħajja

Transcript.text: Il-Whip tal-Oppożizzjoni, Robert Cutajar, kiteb lill-President tal-Kumitat Permanenti dwar il-Familja u lill-President tal-Kumitat Permanenti dwar l-Affarijiet Soċjali sabiex fil-bidu ta’ Settembru tissejjaħ laqgħa konġunta taż-żewġ kumitati parlamentari.

Fi stqarrija tal-Partit Nazzjonalista intqal li t-talba saret biex jiġu diskussi u evalwati ir-regolamenti dwar il-Bilanċ bejn ix-Xogħol u l-Ħajja privata għall-Ġenituri u għall-Persuni li jindukraw. Din it-talba segwit ukoll il-pubblikazzjoni x-xahar li għadda tar-regoli li daħlu fis-seħħ fit-2 t’Awwissu.

transcript eng.Title: PN requests meeting between two Parliamentary Committees regarding the balance between work and the quality of life

Transcript.text: Opposition Whip Robert Cutajar has written to the President of the Permanent Committee for Families and the President of the Permanent Committee for Social Affairs so that at the beginning of September a joint meeting be held by the two committees.
In a statement the Nationalist Party said the request has been made to discuss the balance of life between work and the private life of the family for parents and carers.
This follows the publication last month of regulations that came into force on 2nd August.

transcript mlt.Title: Il-Malti mfittex l-Italja dwar traffikar ta’ droga jinħeles mill-arrest

Transcript.text: John Spiteri ta’ 56 sena mill-Qrendi ingħata l-ħelsien mill-arrest b’depożitu ta’ €20,000 u garanzija personali ta’ €30,000waqt li jrid iffirma kuljum l-għassa.
Spiteri huwa mfittex mill-awtoritajiet Taljani sabiex jaffaċċja akkużi ta’ konfoffa biex iwettaq reat u t-traffikar tal-ħaxixa.
Il-Maġistrat Donatella Frendo Dimech kienet diġà ċaħdet it-talba għall-ħelsien mill-arrest minħabba li xi dokumenti importanti ma kinux ġew esebiti mill-prosekuzzjoni.
Iżda wara li l-Avukat Ġenerali appella mid-deċiżjoni, il-Qorti ta’ l-Appell Kriminali ddikjarat id-deċiżjoni bħala nulla u ddeċidiet li l-każ għandu jerġa’ jinstema’.

Id-difiża argumentat li l-mandat ta’ arrest Ewropew ma fih ebda dettalji dwar il-każ ta’ Spiteri fl-Italja u li m’hemm ebda evidenza kontrih u appellat biex il-Qorti tqis l-imġiba tal-akkużat u mhux dak li hu allegat fil-konfront tiegħu.
Il-każ għall-estradizzjoni ta’ Spiteri, li għandu jidhru għalih lill-Avukati Franco Debono u Charles Mercieca, issa mistenni illi jinqata’ iktar tard dan ix-xahar.

transcript eng.Title: Man wanted for drug trafficking in Italy released on bail

Transcript.text: John Spiteri, aged 56 from Qrendi has been released on bail against a deposit of €20,000 and a personal guarantee of €30,000 and has to register daily at a Police Station.
Spiteri is wanted by Italian Authorities to face accusations of a plan to commit a criminal act and the trafficking of cocaine.
Magistrate Donatella Frendo Dimech had already previously refused to grant bail because important documents had not been produced by the Prosecution.
However, after the Attorney General appealed the decision the Court of Criminal Appeal declared the decision to be null and decreed the case should be heard again.

Spiteri’s Defence argued that the EU Arrest Mandate contains no details about Spiteri’s case and has no evidence of Spiteri’s case in Italy and the Court assesses his conduct and not the allegations made about him.
Lawyers Franco Debono and Charles Mercieca are representing Spiteri and the case regarding his extradition is expected to be finalised later this month.

transcript mlt.Title: Raġel mixli bi qtil jibqa’ miżmum arrestat għax f’pajjiżu kien diġà ħarab

Transcript.text: Serb mixli bil-qtil ta’ Eġizzjan f’Għawdex baqa’ miżmum taħt arrest wara li l-maġistrat irrimarkat li f’pajjiżu kien diġà ħarab mill-pajjiż wara li tressaq fil-Qorti.
Aleksander Stojanovic, ta’ 42 sena li jgħix Ħal Safi, jinsab mixli bil-qtil ta’ Walid Salah Abdel Motaleb Mohamed li nstab maqtul fl-Għarb fil-15 ta’ Jannar 2018.
Għalkemm ix-xhieda li mhux pulizija jew esperti xehdu kollha, il-Maġistrat Donatella Frendo Dimech ċaħditlu t-talba għall-ħelsien mill-arrest.
Hija qalet li minħabba li m’għandux status regolari f’pajjiżna jaf ikollu problema biex isib xogħol u għalhekk jista’ jaħrab minn Malta.
Ara wkoll:

transcript eng.Title: Man charged with murder is remanded in custody following a previous escape from his country

Transcript.text: A Serbian national charged with the murder of an Egyptian national in Gozo has been remanded in custody after the Magistrate remarked he had already absconded from his country after being arraigned in Court.
42-year-old Aleksander Stojanovic, who lives in Ħal Safi, is being charged with the murder of Walid Salah Abdel Motaleb Mohamed, who was found murdered in Għarb on 15 January 2018.
Although non-Police and non-expert witnesses have already given evidence, Magistrate Donatella Frendo Dimech denied a request for bail.
The Magistrate declared that as the accused does not have a regular status in Malta, he might encounter a problem in finding employment and could accordingly abscond from Malta.
See also:

transcript mlt.Title: Il-Kap Eżekuttiv tal-MFSA se jirriżenja għal raġunijiet ta’ saħħa

Transcript.text: L-Awtorità Maltija għas-Servizzi Finanzjarji (MFSA) ħabbret li l-Kap Eżekuttiv tagħha se jtemm il-kariga minħabba raġunijiet ta’ saħħa.
Fi stqarrija, l-MFSA qalet li wara li kien nieqes mix-xogħol għal raġunijiet mediċi, Joseph Gavin iddeċieda li jirtira kmieni u se jieqaf mill-kariga aktar tard matul is-sena.
Gavin, li huwa ta’ nazzjonalità Irlandiża, laħaq fil-kariga f’Lulju 2021 imma fil-15 ta’ Ġunju li għadda l-MFSA ħabbret li huwa kien jinsab indispost.
Fl-istess dikjarazzjoni l-Bord tal-Gvernaturi ħabbar ukoll li kien ħatar lil Dr Michelle Mizzi biex tokkupa l-kariga ta’ Aġent Kap Eżekuttiv.

transcript eng.Title: MFSA Chief Executive to step down for health reasons

Transcript.text: The Malta Financial Services Authority has announced that its Chief Executive is to terminate his appointment for health reasons.
The MFSA said in a statement that after being absent from work for medical reasons, Joseph Gavin has decided on early retirement and will step down later in the year.
Gavin, who is an Irish national, was appointed to the post in July 2021 but the MFSA announced on 15 June this year that he was indisposed.
The Board of Governors announced in the same statement that it was appointing Dr Michelle Mizzi to the post of Deputy Chief Executive.

transcript mlt.Title: Ġibjun fil-Madliena se jiġi rranġat biex is-St John ikollhom ilma għat-tifi tan-nar

Transcript.text: Ġibjun fond 42 metru li jilqa’ 660,000 litru ilma tax-xita se jigi riġenerat biex voluntiera tas-St John Rescue Corps ikunu jistgħu juzawh biex jissupplixxu l-vetturi taghhom tat-tifi tan-nar.
Se jkun ukoll jista’ jintuża għat-tisqija tas-sigar ta’ madwar il-Forti tal-Madliena fejn jinsab dan il-ġibjun.
Tħabbar l-ewwel proġett ta’ riġenerazzjoni ambjentali taħt il-kappa ta’ BELLUS, iffinanzjat mill-Fond Ambjentali tal-Awtorità għall-Ambjent u r-Riżorsi (ERA).
Bl-għajnuna ta’ madwar €61,000, is-St John Rescue Corps se jkunu qed jirrestawraw ġibjun fil-Forti tal-Madliena li huwa 42 metru fond.

Is-sejħa BELLUS – Better Environment in Our Local Urban Spaces – infetħet is-sena l-oħra b’allokazzjoni totali ta’ €500,000. Wara l-evalwazzjoni tal-proposti, intgħażlu 6 proġetti li setgħu jirċievu sa massimu ta’ €100,000.

Waqt żjara f’Forti tal-Madliena mill-Ministru għall-Ambjent, l-Enerġija u l-Intrapriża Miriam Dalli u mill-Aġent Kap Eżekuttiv tal-ERA Kevin Mercieca, ġie spjegat li r-restawr se jinkludi t-tneħħija ta’ skart u ta’ ilma kkontaminat minn ġol-ġibjun, flimkien ma’ ħama u ma’ radam ieħor mill-qiegħ tal-ġibjun li jiflaħ mas-660,000 litru ilma tax-xita.

Fih ser inkunu qed nikkontribwixxu 61,000 litru biex jiġi restawrat ġibjun fil-forti Madliena biex jintuża għat-tisqija tas-siġar tal-madwar kif ukoll biex jimtlew fire-engines tas-St John Rescue Corp. Dan il-proġett, apparti l-għanijiet ambjentali, jikkontribwixxi wkoll biex ikun hemm restawr ta’ forti storika.
Transcript.author: Kevin Mercieca

Transcript.text: Waqt din iż-żjara, il-Ministru Dalli sostniet li dan l-investiment se jgħin biex l-ilma tax-xita jerġa’ jintuża b’mod sostenibbli.
Hija qalet li s-sostenibbiltà hija parti essenzjali f’kull proġett li jsir biex tonqos u f’dan il-każ tgħin biex jonqos l-impatt ambjentali fuq l-estrazzjoni tal-ilma tal-pjan.

transcript eng.Title: Madliena water reservoir to be arranged for St John Rescue Corps to have a water reserve for fire-fighting

Transcript.text: A water reservoir that has a depth of 42 metres and can contain 660,000 litres of rainwater is to be regenerated so that volunteers from the St John Rescue Corps will be able to replenish their fire-fighting vehicles.
The water will also be used for irrigation purposes for the trees around the Madliena Fort.
This is the first regeneration project under BELLUS which is financed by the Environmental and Resources Authority, ERA.
On an investment of about €61,000, the St John Rescue Corps will be restoring the reservoir.

BELLUS – Better Environment in Our Local Urban Spaces – was initiated last year with an alloction of €500,000. After evaluation was carried out six projects were selected that may benefit by a maximum of €100,000.

During a visit by the Minister for the Environment, Energy and Enterprises, Miriam Dalli and the Deputy Head of ERA, Kevin Mercieca, it was explained the restoration will include the removal of refuse and contaminated water as well as other rubble to enable the reservoir to contain 660,000 litres of rainwater.

Mercieca said that 61,000 litres will be used for irrigation for trees around the fort as well as replenishing for St John fire engines. The renovation will also mean the restoration of a historic fort.
During the visit Minister Dalli said this investment will ensure that rainwater is used in a sustainable manner.
She said that sustainability is an essential part of every project to help environmental impact and the extraction of natural water.
Il-Ministru għax-Xogħlijiet Pubbliċi u l-Ippjanar Stefan Zrinzo Azzopardi u s-Sindku tal-Birgu John Boxall inawguraw spazju miftuħ għar-rikreazzjoni tat-tfal magħruf bħala l-Bandli tal-Birgu.

Il-Ministru Stefan Zrinzo Azzopardi spjega kif l-Awtorità tal-Ippjanar, permezz tad-Development Planning Funds, tat għajnuna finanzjarja li tammonta għal kważi €120,000 sabiex isiru xogħlijiet ta’ rinnovazzjoni f’dan il-bandli.
Huwa faħħar ix-xogħlijiet li għamel id-Dipartiment tax-Xogħlijiet Pubbliċi biex fis-sit setgħu jiġu installati l-bandli u l-bankijiet il-ġodda.

Ġie rranġat ukoll il-pavimentar biex l-ilma tax-xita ma jibqax jaqleb għal ġos-swar iżda joħrog għat-triq, kif ukoll ġew restawrati l-ħajt u r-rixtellu ta’ barra u żdiedet il-ħamrija fil-ħwat tas-siġar.

Il-Ministru Zrinzo Azzopardi sostna kif dan il-proġett huwa xhieda oħra tal-ħidma ta’ dan il-Gvern biex iż-żoni urbani jkomplu jiġu rinovati bi proġetti aktar sostenibbli u b’hekk in-nies igawdu minn kwalità ta’ ħajja aħjar.
Huwa rringrazzja lill-Kunsill Lokali tal-Birgu tal-ħidma kontinwa tiegħu u saħaq kif issa l-komunità għandha spazju rikreattiv għall-familji u għat-tfal.
Min-naħa tiegħu, is-Sindku John Boxall wera l-apprezzament tiegħu lejn l- Awtorità tal-Ippjanar għal dan il-fond li hu ta’ għajnuna kbira għall-kunsilli lokali.
Huwa rringrazzja lill-ħaddiema tal-Kunsill Lokali u l-voluntiera li kienu ta’ għajnuna waqt ix-xogħlijiet ta’ dan il-proġett.

Preżenti għal din l-inawgurazzjoni kien hemm il-Perit Vincent Cassar, Chairperson tal-Kumitat tal-Fond tal-Ippjanar tal-Iżvilupp (DPF) tal-Awtorità tal-Ippjanar, u d-Direttur Ġenerali tad-Dipartiment tax-Xogħlijiet Pubbliċi, il-Perit Stephen Bonello.
Minister for Public Buildings and Planning Stefan Zrinzo Azzopardi and Vittoriosa Mayor John Boxall have inaugurated an open recreational space for children, known as Il-Bandli tal-Birgu.

Minister Zrinzo Azzopardi explained that the Planning Authority, through its Development Planning Funds, provided financial assistance amounting to close to 120,000 euro to cover renovation work on the playground.
The Minister praised efforts by Department of Public Works staff to install swings and new benches.
Paving was also upgraded to channel rainwater to the street instead of letting it seep into the bastions. The wall and outer gate have been restored and soil has been added to the tree surrounds.

The Minister stressed that this project is more evidence of this Government’s efforts for the renewal of urban zones through more sustainable projects leading to a better quality of life for the people.
The Minister thanked the Vittoriosa Local Council for their continued efforts, adding that the community now boasts a recreational area for families and children.
Mayor John Boxall expressed his appreciation towards the Planning Authority for this fund which is of great help to Local Councils.
Mr Boxall thanked Local Council workers and volunteers who assisted during work on this project.
Architect Vincent Cassar, Chairperson of the PA’s Development Planning Fund and architect Stephen Bonello, Public Works Department Director-General, were present for the inauguration.
